segment.source: Troubleshoot Windows Defender ATP onboarding issues
segment.target: Troubleshoot Windows Defender ATP onboarding issues

segment.source: Troubleshoot issues that might arise during the onboarding of endpoints or to the Windows Defender ATP service.
segment.target: Troubleshoot issues that might arise during the onboarding of endpoints or to the Windows Defender ATP service.

segment.source: Troubleshoot Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding issues
segment.target: Troubleshoot Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding issues

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]

segment.source: You might need to troubleshoot the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding process if you encounter issues.
segment.target: You might need to troubleshoot the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding process if you encounter issues.

segment.source: This page provides detailed steps for troubleshooting endpoints that aren't reporting correctly, and common error codes encountered during onboarding.
segment.target: This page provides detailed steps for troubleshooting endpoints that aren't reporting correctly, and common error codes encountered during onboarding.

segment.source: Endpoints are not reporting to the service correctly
segment.target: Endpoints are not reporting to the service correctly

segment.source: If you have completed the endpoint onboarding process and don't see endpoints in the Machines view after 20 minutes, it might indicate an endpoint onboarding or connectivity problem.
segment.target: If you have completed the endpoint onboarding process and don't see endpoints in the Machines view after 20 minutes, it might indicate an endpoint onboarding or connectivity problem.

segment.source: Go through the following verification topics to address this issue:
segment.target: Go through the following verification topics to address this issue:

segment.source: Ensure the endpoint is onboarded successfully
segment.target: Ensure the endpoint is onboarded successfully

segment.source: Ensure the Windows Defender ATP service is enabled
segment.target: Ensure the Windows Defender ATP service is enabled

segment.source: Ensure the telemetry and diagnostics service is enabled
segment.target: Ensure the telemetry and diagnostics service is enabled

segment.source: Ensure the endpoint has an Internet connection
segment.target: Ensure the endpoint has an Internet connection

segment.source: Ensure the endpoint is onboarded successfully
segment.target: Ensure the endpoint is onboarded successfully

segment.source: If the endpoints aren't reporting correctly, you might need to check that the Windows Defender ATP service was successfully onboarded onto the endpoint.
segment.target: If the endpoints aren't reporting correctly, you might need to check that the Windows Defender ATP service was successfully onboarded onto the endpoint.

segment.source: Check the onboarding state in Registry:
segment.target: Check the onboarding state in Registry:

segment.source: Click Start, type Run, and press Enter.
segment.target: Click Start, type Run, and press Enter.

segment.source: From the Run dialog box, type regedit and press Enter.
segment.target: From the Run dialog box, type regedit and press Enter.

segment.source: In the Registry Editor navigate to the Status key under:
segment.target: In the Registry Editor navigate to the Status key under:

segment.source: Check the OnboardingState value is set to 1.
segment.target: Check the OnboardingState value is set to 1.

segment.source: Image of OnboardingState status in Registry Editor
segment.target: Image of OnboardingState status in Registry Editor

segment.source: If the OnboardingState value is not set to 1, you can use Event Viewer to review errors on the endpoint.
segment.target: If the OnboardingState value is not set to 1, you can use Event Viewer to review errors on the endpoint.

segment.source: Use Event Viewer to identify and adress onboarding errors:
segment.target: Use Event Viewer to identify and adress onboarding errors:

segment.source: Click Start, type Event Viewer, and press Enter.
segment.target: Click Start, type Event Viewer, and press Enter.

segment.source: In the Event Viewer (Local) pane, expand Applications and Services LogsMicrosoftWindowsSENSE.
segment.target: In the Event Viewer (Local) pane, expand Applications and Services LogsMicrosoftWindowsSENSE.

segment.source: Note SENSE is the internal name used to refer to the behavioral sensor that powers Windows Defender ATP.
segment.target: Note SENSE is the internal name used to refer to the behavioral sensor that powers Windows Defender ATP.

segment.source: Select Operational to load the log.
segment.target: Select Operational to load the log.

segment.source: In the Action pane, click Filter Current log.
segment.target: In the Action pane, click Filter Current log.

segment.source: On the Filter tab, under Event level: select Critical, Warning, and Error, and click OK.
segment.target: On the Filter tab, under Event level: select Critical, Warning, and Error, and click OK.

segment.source: Image of Event Viewer log filter
segment.target: Image of Event Viewer log filter

segment.source: Events which can indicate issues will appear in the Operational pane.
segment.target: Events which can indicate issues will appear in the Operational pane.

segment.source: You can attempt to troubleshoot them based on the solutions in the following table:
segment.target: You can attempt to troubleshoot them based on the solutions in the following table:

segment.source: Event ID
segment.target: Event ID

segment.source: Message
segment.target: Message

segment.source: Resolution steps
segment.target: Resolution steps

segment.source: Windows Advanced Threat Protection service failed to connect to the server at variable
segment.target: Windows Advanced Threat Protection service failed to connect to the server at variable

segment.source: Ensure the endpoint has Internet access.
segment.target: Ensure the endpoint has Internet access.

segment.source: Windows Advanced Threat Protection service failed to read the onboarding parameters.
segment.target: Windows Advanced Threat Protection service failed to read the onboarding parameters.

segment.source: Failure code: variable
segment.target: Failure code: variable

segment.source: Run the onboarding script again.
segment.target: Run the onboarding script again.

segment.source: Windows Advanced Threat Protection service failed to read the onboarding parameters.
segment.target: Windows Advanced Threat Protection service failed to read the onboarding parameters.

segment.source: Failure code: variable
segment.target: Failure code: variable

segment.source: Ensure the endpoint has Internet access, then run the onboarding script again.
segment.target: Ensure the endpoint has Internet access, then run the onboarding script again.

segment.source: Windows Advanced Threat Protection cannot start command channel with URL: variable
segment.target: Windows Advanced Threat Protection cannot start command channel with URL: variable

segment.source: Ensure the endpoint has Internet access.
segment.target: Ensure the endpoint has Internet access.

segment.source: Ensure the Windows Defender ATP service is enabled
segment.target: Ensure the Windows Defender ATP service is enabled

segment.source: If the endpoints aren't reporting correctly, you might need to check that the Windows Defender ATP service is set to automatically start and is running on the endpoint.
segment.target: If the endpoints aren't reporting correctly, you might need to check that the Windows Defender ATP service is set to automatically start and is running on the endpoint.

segment.source: You can use the SC command line program for checking and managing the startup type and running state of the service.
segment.target: You can use the SC command line program for checking and managing the startup type and running state of the service.

segment.source: Check the Windows Defender ATP service startup type from the command line:
segment.target: Check the Windows Defender ATP service startup type from the command line:

segment.source: Open an elevated command-line prompt on the endpoint:
segment.target: Open an elevated command-line prompt on the endpoint:

segment.source: a.
segment.target: a.

segment.source: Click Start, type cmd, and press Enter.
segment.target: Click Start, type cmd, and press Enter.

segment.source: b.
segment.target: b.

segment.source: Right-click Command prompt and select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Command prompt and select Run as administrator.

segment.source: Enter the following command, and press Enter:
segment.target: Enter the following command, and press Enter:

segment.source: If the the service is running, then the result should look like the following screenshot:
segment.target: If the the service is running, then the result should look like the following screenshot:

segment.source: Result of the sq query sense command
segment.target: Result of the sq query sense command

segment.source: If the service START_TYPE is not set to AUTO_START, then you'll need to set the service to automatically start.
segment.target: If the service START_TYPE is not set to AUTO_START, then you'll need to set the service to automatically start.

segment.source: Ensure the telemetry and diagnostics service is enabled
segment.target: Ensure the telemetry and diagnostics service is enabled

segment.source: If the endpoints aren't reporting correctly, you might need to check that the Windows 10 telemetry and diagnostics service is set to automatically start and is running on the endpoint.
segment.target: If the endpoints aren't reporting correctly, you might need to check that the Windows 10 telemetry and diagnostics service is set to automatically start and is running on the endpoint.

segment.source: The service may have been disabled by other programs or user configuration changes.
segment.target: The service may have been disabled by other programs or user configuration changes.

segment.source: First, you should check that the service is set to start automatically when Windows starts, then you should check that the service is currently running (and start it if it isn't).
segment.target: First, you should check that the service is set to start automatically when Windows starts, then you should check that the service is currently running (and start it if it isn't).

segment.source: Ensure the service is set to start
segment.target: Ensure the service is set to start

segment.source: Use the Windows Services console to check the Windows 10 telemetry and diagnostics service startup type:
segment.target: Use the Windows Services console to check the Windows 10 telemetry and diagnostics service startup type:

segment.source: Open the services console:
segment.target: Open the services console:

segment.source: a.
segment.target: a.

segment.source: Click Start and type services.
segment.target: Click Start and type services.

segment.source: b.
segment.target: b.

segment.source: Press Enter to open the console.
segment.target: Press Enter to open the console.

segment.source: Scroll through the list of services until you find Connected User Experiences and Telemetry.
segment.target: Scroll through the list of services until you find Connected User Experiences and Telemetry.

segment.source: Check the Startup type column - the service should be set as Automatic.
segment.target: Check the Startup type column - the service should be set as Automatic.

segment.source: If the startup type is not set to Automatic, you'll need to change it so the service starts when the endpoint does.
segment.target: If the startup type is not set to Automatic, you'll need to change it so the service starts when the endpoint does.

segment.source: Use the Windows Services console to set the Windows 10 telemetry and diagnostics service to automatically start:
segment.target: Use the Windows Services console to set the Windows 10 telemetry and diagnostics service to automatically start:

segment.source: Scroll through the list of services until you find Connected User Experiences and Telemetry.

segment.source: Right-click on the entry and click Properties.
segment.target: Right-click on the entry and click Properties.

segment.source: On the General tab, change the Startup type: to Automatic, as shown in the following image.
segment.target: On the General tab, change the Startup type: to Automatic, as shown in the following image.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Select Automatic to change the startup type in the Properties dialog box for the service
segment.target: Select Automatic to change the startup type in the Properties dialog box for the service

segment.source: Ensure the endpoint has an Internet connection
segment.target: Ensure the endpoint has an Internet connection

segment.source: The Window Defender ATP sensor requires Microsoft Windows HTTP (WinHTTP) to report telemetry and communicate with the Windows Defender ATP service.
segment.target: The Window Defender ATP sensor requires Microsoft Windows HTTP (WinHTTP) to report telemetry and communicate with the Windows Defender ATP service.

segment.source: WinHTTP is independent of the Internet browsing proxy settings and other user context applications and must be able to detect the proxy servers that are available in your particular environment.
segment.target: WinHTTP is independent of the Internet browsing proxy settings and other user context applications and must be able to detect the proxy servers that are available in your particular environment.

segment.source: To ensure that sensor has service connectivity, follow the steps described in the Verify client connectivity to Windows Defender ATP service URLs topic.
segment.target: To ensure that sensor has service connectivity, follow the steps described in the Verify client connectivity to Windows Defender ATP service URLs topic.

segment.source: If the verification fails and your environment is using a proxy to connect to the Internet, then follow the steps described in Configure proxy and Internet connectivity settings topic.
segment.target: If the verification fails and your environment is using a proxy to connect to the Internet, then follow the steps described in Configure proxy and Internet connectivity settings topic.
